IApiParameters.name: scope parameter
documentation:
**scope parameter**

API parameter to pass to the endpoint.

IApiParameters.name: string parameter
documentation:
**string parameter**

String API parameter to pass to the endpoint.

IApiParameters.name: boolean parameter
documentation:
**boolean parameter**

Boolean API parameter to pass to the endpoint.

IApiParameters.name: number parameter
documentation:
**number parameter**

Number API parameter to pass to the endpoint.

ICalculationInputs.name: scope input
documentation:
**scope input**

Additional input to pass to the rendered Kaml View.

ICalculationInputs.name: string input
documentation:
**string input**

Additional input to pass to the rendered Kaml View.

IInputCss.name: container
documentation:
**container**

Space delimitted list of CSS classes to apply to the 'container' (container is determined by the host framework when they create a template for inputs).

IInputCss.name: input
documentation:
**input**

Space delimitted list of CSS classes to apply to the 'input' (input is determined by the host framework when they create a template for inputs).

IInputHelp.name: content
documentation:
**content**

**Required**. HTML markup string to display when input help icon is clicked.  The value can also be provided via the `rbl-input.help` RBLe Calculation value.

IInputHelp.name: title
documentation:
**title**

HTML markup string to use as the popover title when input help icon is clicked.  The value can also be provided via the `rbl-input.help-title` RBLe Calculation value.

IInputHelp.name: width
documentation:
**width**

How wide the Bootstrap popver should be when displayed.  Default value is 250 (pixels).  The value can also be provided via the `rbl-input.help-width` RBLe Calculation value.

IInputEvents.name: handler
documentation:
```javascript
eventHander(
	e: Event,
	application: IKatApp,
	scope: IKaInputScope | IKaInputGroupScope
)
```

Event handler automatically added to the HTMLInputElement based on the property name. The property name follows the same patterns as the [v-on](https://github.com/terryaney/Documentation.Nexgen/blob/main/KatApp.md#v-on) directive (including [modifiers](https://github.com/terryaney/Documentation.Nexgen/blob/main/KatApp.md#v-on-modifiers)).

IInputEvents.name: async handler
documentation:
```javascript
async eventHander(
	e: Event,
	application: IKatApp,
	scope: IKaInputScope | IKaInputGroupScope
) => Promise<void>
```

Event handler automatically added to the HTMLInputElement based on the property name. The property name follows the same patterns as the [v-on](https://github.com/terryaney/Documentation.Nexgen/blob/main/KatApp.md#v-on) directive (including [modifiers](https://github.com/terryaney/Documentation.Nexgen/blob/main/KatApp.md#v-on-modifiers)).

IInputEvents.name: delegate
documentation:
```javascript
eventHander(
	e: Event,
	application: IKatApp,
	scope: IKaInputScope | IKaInputGroupScope
)
```

Event handler automatically added to the HTMLInputElement based on the property name. The property name follows the same patterns as the [v-on](https://github.com/terryaney/Documentation.Nexgen/blob/main/KatApp.md#v-on) directive (including [modifiers](https://github.com/terryaney/Documentation.Nexgen/blob/main/KatApp.md#v-on-modifiers)).

IInputEvents.name: modifier
documentation:
```javascript
eventHander(
	e: Event,
	application: IKatApp,
	scope: IKaInputScope | IKaInputGroupScope
)
```

nEvent handler automatically added to the HTMLInputElement based on the property name. The property name follows the same patterns as the [v-on](https://github.com/terryaney/Documentation.Nexgen/blob/main/KatApp.md#v-on) directive (including [modifiers](https://github.com/terryaney/Documentation.Nexgen/blob/main/KatApp.md#v-on-modifiers)).

IConfirmPrompt.name: content
IConfirmPrompt.snippet: content: ${1|'Are you sure you want to navigate?',application.getLocalizedString('confirmKey')|}
documentation:
**content**

If the content for the modal being displayed is a HTML fragment confirmation message, the HTML markup can be passed directly as a string versus having to build a Kaml View for simple modal confirmations.

IConfirmPrompt.name: contentSelector
documentation:
**contentSelector**

If the content for the modal being displayed is generated by the current application, a DOM element selector string can be passed versus having to build a Kaml View. When `contentSelector` is passed, the KatApp Framework will clone the element's content. Add the attribute [v-pre](https://github.com/terryaney/Documentation.Nexgen/blob/main/KatApp.md#v-pre) if the modal markup should be reactive.

IConfirmPrompt.name: labels
documentation:
**labels**

Provide custom labels to be used when the KatApp framework builds the modal container.

IConfirmPrompt.name: css
documentation:
**css**

Provide custom css to be used when the KatApp framework builds the modal container.

IConfirmPrompt.name: size
documentation:
**size**

By default, if a modal is rendering a Kaml View, the size will be `xl`, otherwise `undefined`. The modal size is based on the value passed in. See [Bootstrap Modal Sizes](https://getbootstrap.com/docs/5.0/components/modal/#optional-sizes) for more information.

IConfirmPrompt.name: scrollable
documentation:
**scrollable**

By default, modal content will not be scrollable; only the *entire modal dialog* is scrollable. If a modal dialog should have its own vertical scrollbar for its body/content, pass `true`.

IConfirmPrompt.name: showCancel
documentation:
**showCancel**

By default, a modal shows both a 'continue' and a 'cancel' button. If the displayed dialog only needs a 'continue' (i.e. confirming a transactional result message), set this value to `true` to hide the 'cancel' button.

IConfirmPromptLabels.name: title
documentation:
**title**

A title can be provided if the modal should display a title. If not provided, no modal header/title will be displayed.

IConfirmPromptLabels.name: continue
documentation:
**continue**

Provide a label to use for the 'continue' button. Default is 'Continue'.

IConfirmPromptLabels.name: cancel
documentation:
**cancel**

Provide a label to use for the 'cancel' button. Default is 'Cancel'.

IConfirmPromptCss.name: continue
documentation:
**continue**

Provide css to apply to the 'continue' button. Default is `btn btn-primary`.

IConfirmPromptCss.name: cancel
documentation:
**cancel**

Provide css to apply to the 'cancel' button. Default is `btn btn-primary-outline`.

v-for.name: row in rbl.source
documentation:
**row in rbl.source**

Use `v-for` to create templated content for each `row` in a RBLe Calculation result table.

v-for.name: row in filtered rbl.source
documentation:
**row in filtered rbl.source**

Use `v-for` to create templated content for each `row` in a filtered RBLe Calculation result table.
The `r => r.column == 'value'` lamda predicate filters the table.  Every row in the table is passed through the lambda and is represented by the variable `r`.

v-for.name: (row, index) in rbl.source
documentation:
**(row, index) in rbl.source**

Use `v-for` to create templated content for each `row` in a RBLe Calculation result table.

The `(row, index)` signature instructs Vue to pass an zero based `index` for every row processed.  Useful to create unique IDs for each row or to do custom processing on the first row (when `index == 0`).

v-ka-value.name: rbl-value id
documentation:
**rbl-value id**

`v-ka-value` can simply be assigned to a [`rbl-value` table id](#https://github.com/terryaney/Documentation.Nexgen/blob/main/KatApp.md#v-ka-value).
v-ka-value="nameFirst"` will return `value` column from `rbl-value` table row where `@id` column is `nameFirst`.

v-ka-value.name: rbl.value('idValue')
documentation:
**rbl.value()**

Return a `value` (undefined if not present) where `id=idValue` from rbl-value table in default CalcEngine/Tab.
`v-ka-value="rbl.value('name-first')"`

v-ka-value.name: . Delimitted String
documentation:
**`.` Delimitted String**

`v-ka-value` can be configured to a [RBLe value selector](#https://github.com/terryaney/Documentation.Nexgen/blob/main/KatApp.md#v-ka-value) in the format of `table.keyValue.returnField.keyField.calcEngine.tab`.

```html
<!-- Table can be omitted, will use rbl-value -->
<div v-ka-value="name-first">
<!--
Return 'value' from 'options' table row
where id='coverage'
-->
<div v-ka-value="options.coverage">
<!--
Return 'value' from 'messages' table row
where type='coverage' from the BRD CalcEngine
-->
<div v-ka-value="messages.add..type.BRD"> 
```

v-ka-value.name: rbl.value() Custom Table/CE/Tab
documentation:
**rbl.value()**

Return a value (undefined if not present) from results given parameters passed in. The CalcEngine key and ITabDef name can be passed in if not using the default CalcEngine and result tab.
`v-ka-value="rbl.value('options', 'coverage')"` : Return `value` from `options` table row where `id='coverage'`.
`v-ka-value="rbl.value('messages', 'add', undefined, 'type', 'BRD')"` : Return `value` from `messages` table row where `type='coverage'` from the BRD CalcEngine.

v-ka-value.name: {} Model
documentation: When using the `. Delimitted String` snippet, since . is the delimitter, it does not support any of the segments containing a period (i.e. the `keyValue` segment).

In this case, use the `{}` model syntax.  Additionally, the only required property is `keyValue`, so it can be easier to read if you only need to change the CalcEngine or Tab. If `table` is `undefined`, `rbl-value` will be used.
`v-ka-value="{ table: 'messages', keyValue: 'abc', ce: 'BRD' }"`

v-ka-value.model.name: table
documentation: The name of the RBLe Calculation table to pull the value from. By default, `rbl-value` will be used.

v-ka-value.model.name: keyValue
documentation: The value to use as a 'key' when searching each `table` row's `keyField` column. By default, `id` will be used for `keyField`.

v-ka-value.model.name: ce
documentation: Specify which CalcEngine results to search (using the CalcEngine `key`, not the `name`. By default, the first CalcEngine in `rbl-config` will be used.

v-ka-value.model.name: returnField
documentation: The column name to return the value from. By default, `value` will be used.

v-ka-value.model.name: keyField
documentation: The column name to search for the supplied `keyValue` value. By default, `id` will be used.

v-ka-value.model.name: tab
documentation: Specify the CalcEngine result tab to search . By default, the first result tab configured for the CalcEngine will be used.

v-ka-resource.name: resource key
documentation:
**key**

Simply supply the resource key as the attribute value without { } model syntax.

v-ka-resource.name: {} Model
documentation:
**v-ka-resource Model**

Use the model syntax to specify a `key` and optionally, any `token` parameters that should be substituted into the resource string.
Each property assigned to the model will automatically replace `{{token}}` in the resource string, where `token` is the name of the model property.

v-ka-resource.model.name: key
documentation:
**key**

The key for the resource string.

v-ka-resource.model.name: token
documentation:
**token**

Additional property on the model to allow for token replacement in the resource string via `String.formatTokens`.
Each property assigned to the model will automatically replace `{{token}}` in the resource string, where `token` is the name of the model property.

v-ka-input.input.name: name
documentation:
**name**

Provide a name to use in KatApp [state inputs](#https://github.com/terryaney/Documentation.Nexgen/blob/main/KatApp.md#icalculationinputs).

v-ka-input.name: name
documentation:
**name**

Provide a name to use in KatApp [state inputs](#https://github.com/terryaney/Documentation.Nexgen/blob/main/KatApp.md#icalculationinputs).

v-ka-input.name: {} Model
documentation:
**v-ka-input Model**

Use the model syntax to specify a `name` and (usually) a `template` along with any other properties available to the `v-ka-input` model.

v-ka-input.model.name: name
documentation:
**name**

Provide a name to use in KatApp [state inputs](#https://github.com/terryaney/Documentation.Nexgen/blob/main/KatApp.md#icalculationinputs).

v-ka-input.model.name: template
documentation:
**template**

The template ID if a template will be used to render markup with the scope.

v-ka-input.model.name: type
documentation:
**type**

Set the type of the associated `HTMLInputElement` when the `tagName=INPUT` (vs `SELECT` or `TEXTAREA`).
If using `type: 'range'`, please see documentation regarding addition events and `ref` elements that must be supplied.

v-ka-input.model.name: value
documentation:
**value**

Provide a default value for the input. The value can also be provided via the `rbl-input.value` RBLe Framework calculation value.
Instead of a string literal, an item in the current 'scope' can be used as well (i.e. `value: item.property` ).

v-ka-input.model.name: label
documentation:
**label**

Provide a display label for the input. The value can also be provided via the `rbl-input.label` RBLe Framework calculation value.
Instead of a string literal, an item in the current 'scope' can be used as well (i.e. `label: item.property` ).

v-ka-input.model.name: placeHolder
documentation:
**placeHolder**

Provide a placeholder for the input. The value can also be provided via the `rbl-input.placeholder` RBLe Framework calculation value.
Instead of a string literal, an item in the current 'scope' can be used as well (i.e. `placeHolder: item.property` ).

v-ka-input.model.name: hideLabel
documentation:
**hideLabel**

Provide a value determining whether the display label should be hidden. The value can also be provided via a RBLe Framework calculation value. If `rbl-input.label == '-1'`, the label will be hidden.
Instead of a explicit `true` or `false` value, an item in the current 'scope' can be used as well (i.e. `hideLabel: item.boolProperty` ).

v-ka-input.model.name: prefix
documentation:
**prefix**

Provide a prefix for the input that could be displayed before the actual input (i.e. with Bootstrap `input-group` markup). The value can also be provided via the `rbl-input.prefix` RBLe Framework calculation value.

v-ka-input.model.name: suffix
documentation:
**suffix**

Provide a suffix for the input that could be displayed before the actual input (i.e. with Bootstrap `input-group` markup). The value can also be provided via the `rbl-input.suffix` RBLe Framework calculation value.

v-ka-input.model.name: maxLength
documentation:
**maxLength**

Provide a maxLength for the input that could be used to limit the length of textual inputs. The value can also be provided via the `rbl-input.max-length` RBLe Framework calculation value.

v-ka-input.model.name: displayFormat
documentation:
**displayFormat**

Provide a C# format string for the input to be used to format the value before displaying it. This is currently used when `type: 'range'`.

v-ka-input.model.name: min
documentation:
**min**

Provide a min value for the input that could be used to limit the minimum allowed value on `date` or `range` inputs. The value can also be provided via the `rbl-input.min` RBLe Framework calculation value.

v-ka-input.model.name: max
documentation:
**max**

Provide a max value for the input that could be used to limit the maximum allowed value on `date` or `range` inputs. The value can also be provided via the `rbl-input.max` RBLe Framework calculation value.

v-ka-input.model.name: step
documentation:
**step**

Provide a step increment value for the input that could be used to control the value increments for `range` inputs. The value can also be provided via the `rbl-input.step` RBLe Framework calculation value.

v-ka-input.model.name: help
v-ka-input.model.snippet: help: { content: '${1:Sample help text to show in popover}'${2:, title: '${3:Sample Title}'} }
documentation:
**help**

Provide the help configuration when the input displays contextual help. The values can also be provided via the `rbl-input.help`, `rbl-input.help-title`, and `rbl-input.help-width` RBLe Framework calculation values.

v-ka-input.model.name: css
documentation:
**css**

Provide the CSS configuration to apply to the rendered `HTMLElement` considered the 'container' or 'input' within a template rendered input.

v-ka-input.model.name: events
documentation:
**events**

Provide a javascript object where each property is an event handler with following signature.

```javascript
eventHander(
	e: Event,
	application: IKatApp,
	scope: IKaInputScope
)
```

These event handlers will automatically be added to HTMLInputElements based on the property name. The property name follows the same patterns as the [v-on](https://github.com/terryaney/Documentation.Nexgen/blob/main/KatApp.md#v-on) directive (including [modifiers](https://github.com/terryaney/Documentation.Nexgen/blob/main/KatApp.md#v-on-modifiers)).

v-ka-input.model.name: list
documentation:
**list**

Provide a list for the input if it renders a list (i.e. SELECT, type="radio", etc.) when building the control. The value can also be provided via the `rbl-input.list` RBLe Framework calculation value which points to a table containing columns of `key` an `text`.

v-ka-input.model.name: mask
documentation:
**mask**

Provide an input mask to apply during user input for text inputs. The value can also be provided via the `rbl-input.mask` RBLe Framework calculation value.

v-ka-input.model.name: keypressRegex
documentation:
**keypressRegex**

Provide an regular expression to evaluate during user input for text inputs. This is to provide a simple, first line of defense against bad input, you can supply a regular expression to inputs via the keypressRegex(s) property that simply evaluates the keyboard input while the user types. Full client/server validation should still be performed, this is simply a UI aid to guard 99% of users. i.e. `\d` would only allow numerical input and `[A-Za-z]` would only allow character input.

v-ka-input.model.name: clearOnUnmount
documentation:
**clearOnUnmount**

If true, when an input is removed from the DOM, the associated `state.inputs` value is also removed.

v-ka-input.model.name: isNoCalc
documentation:
**isNoCalc**

Provide a simple boolean value or a delegate for the input that will be called to determine if an input should *not* trigger an RBLe Framework calculation. The value can also be provided via the `rbl-input.skip-calc` RBLe Framework calculation value.

**Note**: Additionally if any input or input ancestor has [v-ka-rbl-no-calc](https://github.com/terryaney/Documentation.Nexgen/blob/main/KatApp.md#v-ka-rbl-no-calc) or [v-ka-rbl-exclude](https://github.com/terryaney/Documentation.Nexgen/blob/main/KatApp.md#v-ka-rbl-exclude) in the class list, the calculation will not occur.

v-ka-input.model.name: isDisabled
documentation:
**isDisabled**

Provide a simple boolean value or a delegate for the input that will be called to determine if an input should be disabled.
The value can also be provided via the `rbl-input.disabled` RBLe Framework calculation value.

v-ka-input.model.name: isDisplay
documentation:
**isDisplay**

Provide a simple boolean value or a delegate for the input that will be called to determine if an input should be displayed.
The value can also be provided via the `rbl-input.display` RBLe Framework calculation value.

v-ka-input.model.name: iconHtml
v-ka-input.model.snippet: iconHtml: '${1:}'
documentation:
**iconHtml**

Provide additional HTML Markup that could be rendered next to other icons that perform actions. For example, a range input may have an additional icon that should open up a 'worksheet' or `v-ka-modal`.
When using `iconHtml`, to hook up event handlers, the `@vue:mounted="handler.someHandler"` will need to be used.  See documentation for 'Element Lifecycle Events' for more information.

v-ka-input.model.name: uploadEndpoint
documentation:
**uploadEndpoint**

Provide an uploadEndpoint value for the input that could be used if `type="file"` or if the template will render a 'file upload' UI component.

v-ka-input.model.name: clearOnUnmount
documentation:
**clearOnUnmount**

If true, when an input is removed from the DOM, the associated `state.inputs` value is also removed.

v-ka-input.model.name: ce
documentation:
**ce**

Provide the CalcEngine key if all the values that automatically pull from RBLe Framework calculation values should use a CalcEngine different from the default CalcEngine.

v-ka-input.model.name: tab
documentation:
**tab**

Provide the CalcEngine result tab name if all the values that automatically pull from RBLe Framework calculation values should use a tab name different from the default tab specified for the associated CalcEngine.

v-ka-input-group.name: {} Model
documentation:
**v-ka-input-group Model**

Use the model syntax to specify `names`, `type` and a `template` along with any other properties available to the `v-ka-input-group` model.

v-ka-input-group.model.name: names
documentation:
**names**

The array of string names representing each input in the gruop. In RBLe Framework, input names start with lower case `i` and then the remaing part(s) is/are Pascal Case (i.e. ['iFirstName', 'iFirstName2']).

v-ka-input-group.model.name: template
documentation:
**template**

Return the [template](https://github.com/terryaney/Documentation.Nexgen/blob/main/KatApp.md#html-content-template-elements) ID to be used to render group markup with the scope. Unlike the v-ka-input model, here, template is required.

v-ka-input-group.model.name: type
documentation:
**type**

When the associated group of `HTMLInputElement`s `tageName=INPUT` (vs `SELECT` or `TEXTAREA`), you can provide a type.
If using `type: 'range'`, please see documentation regarding addition events and `ref` elements that must be supplied.

v-ka-input-group.model.name: values
documentation:
**values**

The default values for the input group scope can be provided as string literals or from of the current scope. The values can also be provided via the the `rbl-input.value` RBLe Framework calculation value where the `@id` is one of the values provided by `names`.

v-ka-input-group.model.name: labels
documentation:
**labels**

The labels to use for the input group scope can be provided as string literals or from the current scope. The values can also be provided via the `rbl-input.label` RBLe Framework calculation value where the `@id` is one of the values provided by `names`.

v-ka-input-group.model.name: placeHolders
documentation:
**placeHolders**

The placeHolders to use for the input group scope can be provided as an array of strings or simply a single string to use for all inputs in the group.  The values can be a string literal or value from the current scope. The values can also be provided via the `rbl-input.placeholder` RBLe Framework calculation value where the `@id` is one of the values provided by `names`.

v-ka-input-group.model.name: hideLabels
documentation:
**hideLabels**

An array of boolean, or a single boolean to use for all inputs in the group, determining whether the labels should be hidden can be provided.  The values can be a boolean or value from the current scope. The inputs can also be hidden via the `rbl-input.label == -1` in the RBLe Framework calculation where the `@id` is one of the values provided by `names`.

v-ka-input-group.model.name: prefixes
documentation:
**prefixes**

Provide prefixes for the inputs that could be displayed before the actual input (i.e. with Bootstrap `input-group` markup). The values can can be provided as an array of strings or a single string to use for all inputs in the group. The value can also be provided via the `rbl-input.prefix` RBLe Framework calculation value where the `@id` is one of the values provided by `names`.

v-ka-input-group.model.name: suffixes
documentation:
**suffixes**

Provide suffixes for the inputs that could be displayed after the actual input (i.e. with Bootstrap `input-group` markup). The values can can be provided as an array of strings or a single string to use for all inputs in the group. The value can also be provided via the `rbl-input.prefix` RBLe Framework calculation value where the `@id` is one of the values provided by `names`.

v-ka-input-group.model.name: maxLengths
documentation:
**maxLengths**

Provide maxLengths for the inputs that could be used to limit the length of textual inputs. The values can can be provided as an array of number or a single number to use for all inputs in the group. The value can also be provided via the `rbl-input.max-length` RBLe Framework calculation value where the `@id` is one of the values provided by `names`.

v-ka-input-group.model.name: displayFormats
documentation:
**displayFormat**

Provide displayFormats for the inputs that could format a value before displaying it. This is currently used when `type: 'range'`. The values can can be provided as an array of strings or a single string to use for all inputs in the group. The value can also be provided via the `rbl-input.display-format` RBLe Framework calculation value where the `@id` is one of the values provided by `names`.

v-ka-input-group.model.name: mins
documentation:
**mins**

Provide min values for the input that could be used to limit the minimum allowed value on `date` or `range` inputs. The values can can be provided as an array of strings (date), array of numbers (range), single string (date) or a single number (range) to use for all inputs in the group. The value can also be provided via the `rbl-input.min` RBLe Framework calculation value where the `@id` is one of the values provided by `names`.

v-ka-input-group.model.name: maxes
documentation:
**maxes**

Provide max values for the input that could be used to limit the maximum allowed value on `date` or `range` inputs. The values can can be provided as an array of strings (date), array of numbers (range), single string (date) or a single number (range) to use for all inputs in the group. The value can also be provided via the `rbl-input.max` RBLe Framework calculation value where the `@id` is one of the values provided by `names`.

v-ka-input-group.model.name: steps
documentation:
**steps**

Provide step increment values for the inputs that could be used to control the value increments for `range` inputs. The values can can be provided as an array of strings or a single string to use for all inputs in the group. The value can also be provided via the `rbl-input.step` RBLe Framework calculation value where the `@id` is one of the values provided by `names`.

v-ka-input-group.model.name: helps
v-ka-input-group.model.snippet: helps: ${1|[{ title: 'Title 1'\, content: 'Content 1'}\, { title: 'Title 2'\, content: 'Content 2'}],{ title: 'Title 1'\, content: 'Content 1'}|}
documentation:
**helps**

Provide the help configuration when the inputs display contextual help. The values can can be provided as an array of or a single instance of `{ title?: string; content: string; width?: number; }` to use for all inputs in the group. The value can also be provided via the `rbl-input.help`, `rbl-input.help-title`, and `rbl-input.help-width` RBLe Framework calculation value where the `@id` is one of the values provided by `names`.

v-ka-input-group.model.name: css
v-ka-input-group.model.snippet: css: ${1|[{ container: 'class1'\, input: 'class1'}\, { container: 'class2'\, input: 'class2'}],{ container: 'class1'\, input: 'class1'}|}
documentation:
**css**

Provide the CSS configuration to apply to the rendered `HTMLElements` considered the 'containers' or 'inputs' within a template rendered input.  The values can can be provided as an array of or a single instance of `{ container?: string; input?: string; }` to use for all inputs in the group.

v-ka-input-group.model.name: events
documentation:
**events**

Provide a javascript object where each property is an event handler with following signature.

```javascript
eventHander(
	e: Event,
	application: IKatApp,
	scope: IKaInputGroupScope
)
```

These event handlers will automatically be added to HTMLInputElements based on the property name. The property name follows the same patterns as the [v-on](https://github.com/terryaney/Documentation.Nexgen/blob/main/KatApp.md#v-on) directive (including [modifiers](https://github.com/terryaney/Documentation.Nexgen/blob/main/KatApp.md#v-on-modifiers)).

v-ka-input-group.model.name: masks
documentation:
**mask**

Provide an input mask to apply during user input for text inputs. The values can can be provided as an array of strings or a single string to use for all inputs in the group. The value can also be provided via the `rbl-input.mask` RBLe Framework calculation value where the `@id` is one of the values provided by `names`.

v-ka-input-group.model.name: keypressRegexes
documentation:
**keypressRegexes**

Provide a regular expression to evaluate during user input for text inputs. The values can can be provided as an array of strings or a single string to use for all inputs in the group. This is to provide a simple, first line of defense against bad input, you can supply a regular expression to inputs via the keypressRegex(s) property that simply evaluates the keyboard input while the user types. Full client/server validation should still be performed, this is simply a UI aid to guard 99% of users. i.e. `\d` would only allow numerical input and `[A-Za-z]` would only allow character input.

v-ka-input-group.model.name: isNoCalc
documentation:
**isNoCalc**

Provide a simple boolean value or a delegate for the input that will be called to determine if an input should *not* trigger an RBLe Framework calculation. The value can also be provided via the `rbl-input.skip-calc` RBLe Framework calculation value.

**Note**: Additionally if any input or input ancestor has [v-ka-rbl-no-calc](https://github.com/terryaney/Documentation.Nexgen/blob/main/KatApp.md#v-ka-rbl-no-calc) or [v-ka-rbl-exclude](https://github.com/terryaney/Documentation.Nexgen/blob/main/KatApp.md#v-ka-rbl-exclude) in the class list, the calculation will not occur.

v-ka-input-group.model.name: isDisabled
documentation:
**isDisabled**

Provide a simple boolean value or a delegate for the input that will be called to determine if an input should be disabled.
The value can also be provided via the `rbl-input.disabled` RBLe Framework calculation value.

v-ka-input-group.model.name: isDisplay
documentation:
**isDisplay**

Provide a simple boolean value or a delegate for the input that will be called to determine if an input should be displayed.
The value can also be provided via the `rbl-input.display` RBLe Framework calculation value.

v-ka-input-group.model.name: clearOnUnmount
documentation:
**clearOnUnmount**

If true, when an input is removed from the DOM, the associated `state.inputs` value is also removed.

v-ka-input-group.model.name: ce
documentation:
**ce**

Provide the CalcEngine key if all the values that automatically pull from RBLe Framework calculation values should use a CalcEngine different from the default CalcEngine.

v-ka-input-group.model.name: tab
documentation:
**tab**

Provide the CalcEngine result tab name if all the values that automatically pull from RBLe Framework calculation values should use a tab name different from the default tab specified for the associated CalcEngine.

v-ka-navigate.name: View ID
documentation:
**View ID**

Simply provide the string literal name of the view to navigate to.

v-ka-navigate.name: View ID with ki- Params
documentation:
**View ID with ki- Params**

Use a string literal Kaml view ID and pass along `ki-*` query string values.  The spinal case is converted to an input and passed to the newly rendered KatApp/View.
`Common.Profile?ki-view-mode=readonly` would navigate to `Common.Profile` and pass an input of `iViewMode: readonly`.

v-ka-navigate.name: {} Model
documentation:
**v-ka-navigate Model**

Use the model syntax to specify `view` and `inputs` via current scope properties, along with any other properties available to the `v-ka-navigate` model.

v-ka-navigate.model.name: view
documentation:
**view**

The name of the Kaml View to navigate to.

v-ka-navigate.model.name: confirm
v-ka-navigate.model.snippet: confirm: { content: ${1|'Are you sure you want to navigate?',application.getLocalizedString('confirmKey')|} }
documentation:
**confirm**

If a confirmation dialog should be displayed to prompt the user whether or not to allow the navigation, the options for the dialog can be provided.

v-ka-navigate.model.name: inputs
documentation:
**inputs**

If inputs should be passed to the KatApp being navigated to, an [ICalculationInputs](https://github.com/terryaney/Documentation.Nexgen/blob/main/KatApp.md#icalculationinputs) object can be provided.

v-ka-navigate.model.name: ceInputs
documentation:
**ceInputs**

Some CalcEngines return an key/value space delimitted string of inputs in their result tables with the intention of those values being passed in as a representation of [ICalculationInputs](https://github.com/terryaney/Documentation.Nexgen/blob/main/KatApp.md#icalculationinputs).

v-ka-navigate.model.name: persistInputs
documentation:
**persistInputs**

Whether or not to persist the inputs in sessionStorage. If true and the user navigates away from current view and comes back the inputs will automatically be injected into the KatApp. If false and the user navigates away and returns the input values will not longer be present. The default value is false.

v-ka-navigate.model.name: model
documentation:
**model**

If the entire `IKaNavigateModel` parameter is being provided by a CalcEngine via a valid 'JSON string', this property can be assigned in place of using all the above individual properties.

v-ka-navigate.model.name: clearDirty
documentation:
**clearDirty**

Control whether or not the application's `state.isDirty` property should be set to `false` before navigation.

v-ka-template.name: Template ID
documentation:
**Template ID**

Simply provide the string literal ID of the template to render.

v-ka-template.name: Template with rbl.source
documentation:
**Template with rbl.source**

Render the supplied template for each row returned from the rbl.source and optional filter predicate.

v-ka-template.name: Template with Custom Source
documentation:
**Template with Custom Source**

Render the supplied template passing in the custom `source` object for use inside the template.

v-ka-template.model.name: name
documentation:
**name**

The name of the template to render.

v-ka-template.model.name: source
documentation:
**source**

The source that should have all its properties provided as an addition to the current scope to use within the template markup.

v-ka-template.source.model.name: source property
documentation:
**source property**

Additional property that should be provided as an addition to the current scope to use within the template markup.

v-ka-api.name: {} Model
documentation:
**{} Model**

Provide the model containing the properties that configure how a `v-ka-api` link behaves when clicked.

v-ka-api.model.name: endpoint
documentation:
**endpoint**

The api endpoint to submit to.

v-ka-api.model.name: confirm
v-ka-api.model.snippet: confirm: { content: ${1|'Are you sure you want to submit?',application.getLocalizedString('confirmKey')|} }
documentation:
**confirm**

If a confirmation dialog should be displayed to prompt the user whether or not to allow the api submission, the options for the dialog can be provided.

v-ka-api.model.name: calculationInputs
documentation:
**calculationInputs**

Often when an api endpoint is submitted to in a Host Environment that leverages the RBLe Framework, an iValidate=1 RBL calculation is the first action performed on the server. This calculation can do UI validations or provide instructions to the Host Environment on what type of actions it should take. All the inputs from the UI are always submit, but if additional inputs should be passed to the endpoint, an [ICalculationInputs](https://github.com/terryaney/Documentation.Nexgen/blob/main/KatApp.md#icalculationinputs) object can be provided.

v-ka-api.model.name: apiParameters
documentation:
**apiParameters**

Some endpoints require parameters that are processed in the server code of the Host Environment. The inputs can be `string`, `boolean`, or `number` and are only used by server side code and never passed to an RBLe Framework calculation.

v-ka-api.model.name: isDownload
documentation:
**isDownload**

If the api endpoint being posted to will return binary content representing a download, setting this flag to true tells the KatApp framework to process the results differently and save the generated content as a downloaded.

v-ka-api.model.name: calculateOnSuccess
documentation:
**calculateOnSuccess**

If after a successful submission to an api endpoint, the KatApp Framework should automatically trigger a RBLe Framework Calculation, `calculateOnSuccess` can be set. Setting the value to `true` indicates that a calculation should occur. Setting the value to an `ICalculationInputs` object also indicates that a calculation should occur and additionally pass along the inputs provided. See `v-ka-api` Model Samples for more information.

v-ka-api.model.name: thenAsync
v-ka-api.model.snippet: thenAsync: async response => { console.log( 'API has completed, could do something sync or async' ); console.log( response ); }
documentation:
```javascript
thenAsync(
	response: IStringAnyIndexer | undefined,
	application: KatApp
) => Promise<void>
```

If the Kaml View needs to provide a delegate to run if an api submission is successful, the `thenAsync` property solves that problem. See `v-ka-api` Model Samples for more information.

v-ka-api.model.name: catchAsync
v-ka-api.model.snippet: catchAsync: response => { console.log( 'API has failed' ); console.log( response ); }
documentation:
```javascript
catchAsync(
	e: Error | any | undefined,
	application: KatApp
) => Promise<void>
```

If the Kaml View needs to provide a delegate to run if an api submission failed, the `catchAsync` property solves that problem. See `v-ka-api` Model Samples for more information.
If no `catchAsync` is provided and an api endpoint fails, the response will simply be logged by the KatApp framework.

v-ka-modal.name: {} Model
documentation:
**{} Model**

Provide the model containing the properties that configure how a `v-ka-modal` link and application behaves when clicked.

v-ka-modal.model.name: view
documentation:
**view**

If the content for the modal being displayed is generated from a Kaml View, the name of the Kaml View 'id' should be assigned here. When present, the KatApp Framework calls the `katapp/verify` endpoint to ensure that the current user has access to the view before returning the content for the view.

v-ka-modal.model.name: calculateOnConfirm
documentation:
**calculateOnConfirm**

When a modal application is 'confirmed', using the `calculateOnConfirm` property can instruct the KatApp Framework to automatically run a RBLe Framework calculation.
Setting this property to `true` or providing a `ICalculationInputs` object will trigger the automatic calculation.

v-ka-modal.model.name: buttonsTemplate
documentation:
**buttonsTemplate**

By default, KatApp modals will generate a 'continue' and 'cancel' button that are always visible and simply return a `boolean` value indicating whether or not a modal was confirmed.
If a modal is more complex with various stages that influence the behavior (visibility or functionality) of the modal buttons, a template ID can be provided.
See `IModalOptions` Template Samples for more information.

v-ka-modal.model.name: headerTemplate
documentation:
**headerTemplate**

By default, KatApp modals simply use the `labels.title` string property to display a 'modal header'.
If a modal is more complex and the header is more than just a text label (i.e. links or inputs), a template ID can be provided as the content to be rendered inside the header.
See `IModalOptions` Template Samples for more information.

v-ka-modal.model.name: beforeOpenAsync
v-ka-modal.model.snippet: beforeOpenAsync: async ()) => { console.log( 'Before showing modal, could do something sync or async' ); }
documentation:
```javascript
beforeOpenAsync(
	application: KatApp
) => Promise<void>
```

When a modal is displayed using the [IModalOptions.contentSelector](https://github.com/terryaney/Documentation.Nexgen/blob/main/KatApp.md#imodaloptions) property, at times it is necessary to update the content dynamically before rendering the modal. This event enables the host application to update reactive model properties before rendering the modal. See `v-ka-modal` Model Samples for more information.

v-ka-modal.model.name: confirmedAsync
v-ka-modal.model.snippet: confirmedAsync: response => { console.log( 'Modal confirmed, could do something sync or async' ); console.log( response ); }
documentation:
```javascript
confirmedAsync(
	response: any | undefined,
	application: KatApp
) => Promise<void>
```

If the Kaml View needs to provide a delegate to run if modal dialog is 'confirmed', the `confirmedAsync` property solves that problem. See `v-ka-modal` Model Samples for more information.

v-ka-modal.model.name: cancelledAsync
v-ka-modal.model.snippet: cancelledAsync: response => { console.log( 'Modal cancelled, could do something sync or async' ); console.log( response ); }
documentation:
```javascript
cancelledAsync(
	response: any | undefined,
	application: KatApp
) => Promise<void>
```

If the Kaml View needs to provide a delegate to run if modal dialog is 'cancelled', the `cancelledAsync` property solves that problem. See `v-ka-modal` Model Samples for more information.

v-ka-modal.model.name: catchAsync
v-ka-modal.model.snippet: catchAsync: e => { console.log( 'Modal failed, could do something sync or async' ); console.log( e ); }
documentation:
```javascript
catchAsync(
	e: Error | any | undefined,
	application: KatApp
) => Promise<void>
```

If the Kaml View needs to provide a delegate to run if generating a modal dialog fails, the `catchAsync` property solves that problem. See `v-ka-modal` Model Samples for more information.
If no `catchAsync` is provided and generating a modal dialog fails, the response will simply be logged by the KatApp framework.

v-ka-modal.model.name: model
documentation:
**model**

If the *entire* `IKaModalModel` parameter is being provided by a CalcEngine via a valid 'JSON string', this property can be assigned in place of using all the individual properties.

v-ka-app.name: {} Model
documentation:
**{} Model**

Provide the model containing the properties that configure how a `v-ka-modal` link and application behaves when clicked.

v-ka-app.model.name: view
documentation:
**view**

The Kaml View to render inside the nested KatApp.

v-ka-app.model.name: selector
documentation:
**selector**

If provided, a JQuery selector `string` that is used to identify that KatApp. This property aids in debugging by allowing Kaml View developers to type in `KatApp.get({selector})` in a browser console to get a reference to their KatApp.

v-ka-app.model.name: inputs
documentation:
**inputs**

If inputs should be passed to the rendered nested application's Kaml View, provide a [ICalculationInputs](https://github.com/terryaney/Documentation.Nexgen/blob/main/KatApp.md#icalculationinputs) object.

v-ka-table.name: Table Name
documentation:
**Table Name**

Simply provide the string literal name of the RBLe Framework result table to process.

v-ka-table.name: {} Model
documentation:
**{} Model**

Provide name and other model properties of the RBLe Framework result table to process.

v-ka-table.model.name: name
documentation:
**name**

The name of the RBLe Framework result table to process.

v-ka-table.model.name: css
documentation:
**css**

The css that should be applied to the rendered `<table>` element. If not provided, `table table-sm table-hover` is applied.

v-ka-table.model.name: ce
documentation:
**ce**

If the RBLe Framework results to process is not part of the default Kaml View CalcEngine, a CalcEngine key can provided.

v-ka-table.model.name: tab
documentation:
**tab**

If the RBLe Framework results to process is not part of the default result tab (`RBLResult`), a tab name can provided.

v-ka-highchart.name: Table Name
documentation:
**Table Name**

Simply provide the string literal partial name of the RBLe Framework result tables to process.
Given the `tableName`, the `Highcharts-tableName-Data` and `Highcharts-tableName-Options` tables will be used.

v-ka-highchart.name: Data/Options Names
documentation:
**Data/Options**

Simply provide the `.` delimitted string literal that contains the partial names of the 'data' and 'options' result tables to process.
Given the `dataName` and `optionName`, the `Highcharts-dataName-Data` and `Highcharts-optionsName-Options` tables will be used.

v-ka-highchart.name: {} Model
documentation:
**{} Model**

Provide data name and other model properties used to generate the Highchart.

v-ka-highchart.model.name: data
documentation:
**data**

The *partial* name of the RBLe Framework result table providing the 'data' to the chart. This value will be translated into `Highcharts-{model.data}-Data` when retrieving results from the calculation.

v-ka-highchart.model.name: options
documentation:
**options**

The *partial* name of the RBLe Framework result table providing the 'options' for the chart. This value will be translated into `Highcharts-{model.options}-Options` when retrieving results from the calculation. If not provided, the `model.data` property will be used.

v-ka-highchart.model.name: ce
documentation:
**ce**

If the RBLe Framework results to process is not part of the default Kaml View CalcEngine, a CalcEngine key can provided.

v-ka-highchart.model.name: tab
documentation:
**tab**

If the RBLe Framework results to process is not part of the default result tab (`RBLResult`), a tab name can provided.

v-ka-attributes.name: Scope Property
documentation:
**Scope Property**

Provide source for the string delimitted attributes to assign.  Usually comes from a rbl.source row.
